doc.name: modifiedMark

syntax.example: set the modifiedMark of stack to {true | false}

doc.summary: Specifies whether the modified indicator dot should be displayed on the close-box of a stack.

examples.example: set the modifiedMark of stack 1 to true

description.overview: Use the modifiedMark property to display the modified state of a stack.
description.value: The modifiedMark of stack is true or false.
description.comments:
Standard Mac document windows typically display the modified state of the document they represent by adding a dark dot to the close-box. It is possible to control the display of this dot in LiveCode by using the modifiedMark property.
The indicator will be displayed when the property is set to true.
This property has no effect on Windows nor Linux.
